nodes.text: An e-nursery retail website that integrates clustering-based recommendation and visual data representation will improve user experience and optimize business operations for plant nurseries
Collecting structured data about plants, customers, and feedback is necessary to power recommendations and visualizations
Implementing a clustering algorithm on cleaned customer data groups similar users by preferences and behavior to enable personalized product suggestions
Visual data representation using tools like Tableau and Matplotlib provides dashboards and charts that make sales, customer demographics, and product popularity insights accessible to stakeholders
A user-facing web application with secure login, registration, cart, checkout, and payment gateway integration is required to operationalize the e-nursery platform
Data sources specified: plant database with attributes and pricing, customer registrations (demographics, purchase and search history), and product reviews/ratings
Recommended clustering algorithms include K-means and hierarchical clustering to segment users for the recommendation engine
Generating recommendations maps cluster membership to products favored by the cluster, using past purchases and search behavior to suggest items
Integrating Tableau to the project database and designing interactive dashboards allows filtering and drill-down to explore metrics
Implemented web interfaces reported in results: login, registration, home, add-to-cart, checkout, payment receipt, and payment gateway integration
The implemented GUI demonstrates core e-commerce workflows and secure transaction processing using common gateways (example: PayPal, Visa)
Project example evidence: when a user had previously added Piper Betel Maghal, the system recommended Aloe vera, demonstrating personalized plant recommendation
Literature supports clustering and hybrid recommendation approaches as effective for e-commerce personalization and addressing cold-start and sparsity issues
Clustering plus visualization can aid administrators in inventory management, marketing strategy, and informed decision-making

Conclusion: Integrating clustering algorithms and visual data representation yields a user-friendly, data-driven e-nursery platform that enhances shopping experience, customer engagement, and operational efficiency
